content.description: The crux is moving to and past the last bolt.  Nice route. Slightly overhanging, and sustained near the top.
content.protection: Five bolts with shuts for anchors.
content.location: Just left of "Singing in the Rain".  Located at the top of the ramp at the Ivory Tower area.

content.description: The crux is between the third and fourth bolt - balancey and little hands.  It is a pumpy climb, although deceivingly chunky.
content.protection: 4 bolts, two cold shuts for anchors/rap
content.location: The route is on the back wall of the wide fissure located to the left of the Ivory (whitish) Tower.

content.description: Short face climb past two bolts.
content.location: around the corner from Flying Chipmunk crack.

content.description: The crux (I think) is moving past the fourth bolt.  There the climbing is thin, and balance is key to making the next clip.  Clip the fifth hanger from the nice pocket.
content.protection: Seven bolts with two shuts for the rap.
content.location: Located on Ivory Tower proper.  This arete climb is a classic for the area.  Two anchors at the base of the climb protect your belayer.

content.description: Face climbing with some good footwork needed to get through the crux
content.location: Face left of The Flying Chipmunk

content.description: Left arching crack. Mostly hands jams, few places for face relief. Fun crack climbing.
content.protection: Gear - hands to thin hands at top
content.location: Upper section of Ivory Tower area - obvious left-trending crack.

content.description: This route offers some nice moves on a low angle face. Small pockets and side pulls enable a delicate finish to two shuts.  Not a great climb, but fun enough.
content.protection: Five bolts and a two shut anchor.
content.location: Located just right of Sunny Delight.  This climb is the right most climb at the top of the ramp at the Ivory Tower area.

content.description: A nice place to climb in the winter months, and extremely hot in the summer months.  From the parking area, a whitish rock tower is visible.  A handful of sport and crack climbs are on the exterior.  To the left of the tower there are more climbs in a wide fissure requiring a 5th class scramble.
